integrations_researched.name: shadcn/ui

verified_package.name: shadcn/ui (CLI-based, not npm package)
verified_package.install_command: npx shadcn@latest init && npx shadcn@latest add button card input textarea checkbox badge table select scroll-area sheet collapsible form

imports: import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card'
import { Table, TableBody, TableCell, TableHead, TableHeader, TableRow } from '@/components/ui/table'
import { Select, SelectContent, SelectItem, SelectTrigger, SelectValue } from '@/components/ui/select'
import { Form, FormControl, FormField, FormItem, FormLabel, FormMessage } from '@/components/ui/form'
api_patterns.initialization: Components are installed via CLI into /components/ui/ directory. Requires tailwind.config.js with CSS variables setup.
key_functions: cn() utility for className merging from @/lib/utils

gotchas: Components are copied into your project, not installed as npm packages
Requires proper tailwind.config.js setup with CSS variables
Form component requires react-hook-form integration
Uses Radix UI primitives under the hood

integrations_researched.name: TanStack Table

imports: import { ColumnDef, flexRender, getCoreRowModel, getFilteredRowModel, useReactTable } from '@tanstack/react-table'
api_patterns.initialization: const table = useReactTable({ data, columns, getCoreRowModel: getCoreRowModel(), getFilteredRowModel: getFilteredRowModel() })

gotchas: TanStack Table is headless - you provide your own UI components
Global filter requires state management: globalFilterFn and onGlobalFilterChange
Column definitions should use accessorKey or accessorFn
Cell rendering uses flexRender() function

integrations_researched.name: React Hook Form

api_patterns.initialization: const form = useForm({ resolver: zodResolver(schema), defaultValues: {...} })

gotchas: Must use register() or Controller for field registration
formState.isSubmitting requires tracking async submission
defaultValues should match schema structure
Use form.reset() to reset form values

integrations_researched.name: Zod

api_patterns.initialization: const schema = z.object({ firstName: z.string().min(1, 'Required'), email: z.string().email('Invalid email').optional() })

gotchas: Use z.infer<typeof schema> for TypeScript type inference
Empty string validation: use z.string().email().or(z.literal('')) for optional email
parse() throws on invalid data, safeParse() returns result object

integrations_researched.name: @hookform/resolvers (Zod Resolver)
gotchas: Automatically infers TypeScript types from Zod schema
Use valueAsNumber: true for number inputs with register()

integrations_researched.name: react-signature-canvas

api_patterns.initialization: const sigCanvas = useRef<SignatureCanvas>(null); <SignatureCanvas ref={sigCanvas} canvasProps={{ className: 'w-full h-full' }} backgroundColor='white' />

gotchas: Must use useRef to access SignatureCanvas methods
isEmpty() returns true if canvas is empty - use for validation
toDataURL() returns base64 PNG - can be stored in database
Canvas must have explicit width/height or CSS dimensions
backgroundColor prop sets the canvas background color

integrations_researched.name: Lucide React

imports: import { Menu, Users, FileText, LogOut, Plus, Pencil, FileSignature, CheckCircle, AlertCircle, ChevronDown, ArrowLeft, RotateCcw, Check, Loader2, Search } from 'lucide-react'
api_patterns.initialization: <Menu className='h-5 w-5' /> or <Loader2 className='h-4 w-4 animate-spin' />
key_functions: Icon components accept: className, size, color, strokeWidth props

gotchas: Icons are tree-shakeable - only imported icons are bundled
Use className for sizing with Tailwind (e.g., h-4 w-4)
Icons render as inline SVG elements

integrations_researched.name: react-markdown
gotchas: Markdown content is passed as children, not as a prop
Use components prop to customize element rendering
Supports remark/rehype plugins for extended functionality
Renders markdown safely - no XSS vulnerabilities

integrations_researched.name: Sonner

verified_package.name: sonner
verified_package.note: Project currently uses react-toastify - may need to switch to sonner for shadcn/ui compatibility

api_patterns.initialization: Render <Toaster /> in layout, then use toast('message') or toast.success('message'), toast.error('message')

gotchas: Toaster component must be rendered in your app (typically in layout)
toast() returns a toastId that can be used with toast.dismiss()
Duration is 4000ms by default, use duration: Infinity for persistent toasts
Position defaults to bottom-right, can be changed via prop

integrations_researched.name: clsx + tailwind-merge

api_patterns.initialization: export function cn(...inputs: ClassValue[]) { return twMerge(clsx(inputs)); }

gotchas: cn() utility should be defined in lib/utils.ts
twMerge intelligently merges conflicting Tailwind classes
clsx handles conditional classes and array inputs

recommendations: Project already has zod, react-hook-form, @hookform/resolvers, lucide-react, clsx, and tailwind-merge installed
Consider switching from react-toastify to sonner for better shadcn/ui integration (or keep react-toastify if preferred)
Run shadcn CLI to add required components: npx shadcn@latest add button card input textarea checkbox badge table select scroll-area sheet collapsible form
Create cn() utility function in lib/utils.ts if not already present
Ensure tailwind.config.js is configured with CSS variables for shadcn/ui theming
